thread.title: Melania Trump may never move to White House to be first lady with husband President Donald Trump
thread.title_full: Melania Trump may never move to White House to be first lady with husband President Donald Trump | Daily Telegraph

author: Yaron Steinbuch
title: Melania Trump may never move to White House to be first lady with husband President Donald Trump
text:
US FIRST lady Melania Trump may remain in the Big Apple after all, according to a report.
The New York Post reports that President Donald Trump and his wife announced in November that she would relocate from New York City to the White House once their 10-year-old son, Barron, wraps up the school year.
But a family insider now says that move may not happen, according to the new issue of Us Weekly .
“They will re-evaluate toward the end of the school year if they will keep this arrangement or if Melania and Barron will move to Washington,” the source said. “They could go either way right now. They will ultimately do what’s best for Barron.”
media_camera Donald Trump (L), his wife Melania and their then 10-month-old son Barron in 2007. Picture: AFP
A presidential long-distance relationship is unprecedented, but the commander-in-chief doesn’t appear to be broken up.
Asked last month by ABC News whether not having Mrs Trump, 46, and their boy around left him lonely, he said: “No, because I end up working longer. And that’s OK.”
Meanwhile, the first couple will take turns shuttling between their $100 million Trump Tower triplex in Manhattan and the White House.
“They’ll come down on weekends,” he told The New York Times on January 25.
media_camera US President Donald Trump reaches out to embrace son Barron Trump as First Lady Melania Trump, Donald Trump Jr, Ivanka Trump (C), Eric Trump and Tiffany Trump look on after his inauguration. Picture: Getty
“Melania is actively building her team, including hiring a chief of staff, a senior adviser and a social secretary, among other key positions,” a source close to Mrs Trump told the mag. “While she is a mum first, she is very much embracing the role and responsibilities of first lady.”
This article originally appeared in the New York Post
 Melania ‘may never move to White House’
